title: Salahmu
author: Salahmu
content: Omo nawa ooo, this country e get as e be ooo, people nava recover from the first fuel price way be 520 naira and they increase it to 620 e nava do them just this morning it was announced that fuel should be sell on the rate 720 naira per litter, things are really going to be though in this country, maybe the only way for us to survive is to diversify our means of transportation by going for electric car or motorcycle just like a topic created on this thread on how electric car will help to remedy lack of movement caused by increase of fuel, this is actually the time for it. The cost of living in this country is something else ooh Very soon the price will rise to 1000 per litter, and the annoying part of it is that the increase has greatly affected food stuffs, things we normally buy on a certain amount is no longer sell on that way. Even gas price has also increase, the question now is that how much more can Nigerians take?

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: https://punchng.com/forex-crisis-marketers-propose-n720-litre-suspend-fuel-imports/?ampIt would be better if you include a link of a news about it.It would become worse and worse if Nigeria continue to depend on imports. Nigeria has crude, the largest in Africa, but they continue to depend on foreign nations. Quote from: https://punchng.com/forex-crisis-marketers-propose-n720-litre-suspend-fuel-imports/?ampOil marketers, on Sunday, indicated that the cost of Premium Motor Spirit, popularly called petrol, would rise to between N680/litre and N720/litre in the coming weeks should the dollar continue to trade from N910 to N950 at the parallel market.They also hinted that dealers seeking to import PMS were being forced to put the plans on hold due to the scarcity of foreign exchange to import the commodity.The warning came barely one week after the local currency crossed the N900/dollar ceiling, with the naira selling at over 945/dollar at the parallel market on Friday.Oil dealers said the CBN Importers and Exporters official window for foreign exchange, which boast of a lower exchange rate of about $740/litre, had remained illiquid and unable to provide the $25m to $30m required for the importation of PMS by dealers.

comments.author: Marykeller
comments.body: As far as sae Nigeria as a country never still get their own refinery and they still d export their crude oil go other countries to refine, petroleum price go d increase from time to time without decreasing. Em d so pitiful that the giant of Africa wey claim to be no get no single refinery up till this moment. Despite all the money wey we get for the country, none of our leaders wey em don bother for em heart to reason sae, it's time for the giant of Africa to have a working refinery. All of them prefer to d refine our God-given crude oil for abroad, and import am back go give at high price. No be wickedness be that? If you check the world crude oil exporting countries and number of active refinery wey dem get, you go see sae Nigeria no get one. You can check it out on the link provide to know how many active refinery wey countries for the world gethttps://www.nairaland.com/7783216/crude-oil-exporting-countries-numbers After you don check on the list finish, now as yourself whether those countries wey get refineries richer than us for us to have a refinery of our own. Having said that, peso know no when the cost of living go decrease a bit. Naso em go d increase d go. It's now wey Nigerians enter the real shege banza for Tinubu hand. I just pray make the Tribunal judgment wey go happen next month be in favor of peoples choice president. If not the hardship continues to another 8years(God forbid sha).

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: As a matter of fact, where the problem lies is that Nigeria is a consuming nation. Virtually everything we use is imported into the country even the least things we need import are imported so tell me how does the economy be stable.  We have no working or functional refinery to refine our crude instead we sell our crude oil or swap for refined products and still import it with loss. The cabals are just using this country as their football pitch where they could just host a match sit and watch how it goes. Sorry to say this Nigeria is a laboratory where experiments are done and the results are put on trial to see the outcome and reactions of her citizens.With regards to the electric cars you have said OP. If fuel alone would cause such an uproar is it the electricity that is epileptic that you would depend on to power your electric car and bike? How often do you have electricity power supply? Do you think there is any charging taminal for such if it gets drained of power on high way? Or is it the one that you will be given over estimated bill for what you did not consume monthly?Nigeria is not yet set to even be independent. What is it with all these over dependence on foreign import yet we claim we are independent and we cannot even produce to export so as to have a balanced economy. Currency being devalued everyday. Poor salary structure for civil servants but yet on them the nation's economy and administration is managed.What a nation!!

Even gas price has also increase, the question now is that how much more can Nigerians take?  In Nigeria fuel price control and determine the price other commodities and also determine the services in the country. So any hike in fuel price affact greatly everything in the country. The increment of fuel pump price is nothing but it is a well calculated plan by the marketers to suffer the citizens. Because I can also still vividly remember on the national TV station AIT Politics Today in the year 2013/14 when the then president increase fuel price by removing fuel subsidy, an Economist, a financial analyst came out and said, even without the subsidy, the marketers can sell their fuel and have the gain of #5 on top as a profit they will still make it well. Which means the increase of it to this high price is a wicked act of the marketers for excess profit. You have said what I was thinking. The price of fuel will climb to 1k per liter. And we should not worry, everything will be stable. Fuel is going to be a thing of the past, electricity mobilization is going to take place and for home uses, solar system will do that for us. But the only problem wey we go get bi say, Niger Delta go suffer for solar, because of the weather condition in the region. And that cannot withstanding, gas is going to do it's work. Let me tell one thing, Nigerians are talented. There was a time, mechanics in Nigeria in the Goodluck Jonathan time produce Generators without fuel. And they were using it to power their house, and National House of Assembly dat stop that invention in the country because of di fuel marketers heard it sponsored a bill to stop di process. So this hardship will bring back many things again.

I believe di effect of  subsidy removal no suppose be like dis if our government no rush into it unprepared and everything wey dey happen now na we dey suffer am. Dem suppose don put in order all our local refineries before dem remove di subsidy, does it make any difference removing subsidy wen we go still export dis petroleum products to foreign countries and bring am back to Nigeria? What about di logistics? Now dem come dey tell us say di reason wey di price fit increase na because of dollar wey dey rise against naira, if dem no dey export am dem no go give us dis reason. Na God go help us for dis country.

comments.author: RahimNda
comments.body: Because of the high cost of fuel—from 620 now that they just announced that it will climb to 720—which will cause a great deal of difficulty in the nation, the country is really moving to something else. We just talked about the withdrawal of a new subsidy a few weeks ago, and we are still dealing with certain adjustments. I believe that switching to electric vehicles will be the wisest course of action in the current climate in these country. And we also need to bring back some of our talented engineers, so that they can produce what will be more else for us and also useful to the country.
